snippet: Five blasts, apparently aimed at civilians, may be harbingers of a dangerous new phase of violence in a 21-month pro-democracy uprising.
abstract: Five bombs explode in capital of Bahrain, killing two foreign workers and critically injuring third, in sharp intensification of violence that has simmered in island nation since beginning of pro-democracy uprising 21 months earlier.
lead_paragraph: Five blasts, apparently aimed at civilians, may be harbingers of a dangerous new phase of violence in a 21-month pro-democracy uprising.

headline.seo: Bombs in Bahrain’s Capital Kill Two Foreigners
headline.main: Bombs in Bahrain’s Capital Kill 2 Foreigners
headline.print_headline: Bombs in Bahrain’s Capital Kill 2 Foreigners
